t: For the choir director: with stringed instruments. A psalm of David.
Answer*pn me when I call, God,*ln who vindicates me. You*ln freed me from affliction; be*ln gracious to me and hear my prayer.
How*pn long, exalted ones, will my honor be insulted? How*ln long will you love what is worthless and*ln pursue a lie? Selah*ig
Know*ln that the Lord*s has set apart the*ln faithful for himself; the*ln Lord*s will hear when I call to him.
Be*ln angry and do not sin; reflect*ln in your heart while on your bed and be silent. Selah*ig
Offer*ln sacrifices in righteousness and*ln trust in the Lord.*s
Many*pn are asking, “Who can show us anything good?” Let*ln the light of your face shine on us, Lord.*s
You*pn have put more joy in my heart than*ln they have when their grain and new wine abound.
I*ln will both lie down and sleep in peace, for*ln you alone, Lord,*s make me live in safety.
